intro: Hieracium algidiforme, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are broadly lanceolate, hairy, and often have a bluish-green color, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer. Hieracium algidiforme is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions, making it a common sight in mountainous landscapes.
